reviews.sentence: Unbeatable location. The location of this hotel is fantastic. Walk to restaurants shops the pier historic buildings. can not be beat. Giant open lobby with a nice restaurant and our room was lovely clean bathrobes nice toiletries etc. The only less than ideal aspects are 1 the hotel is very very spread out and there is only one bank of elevators. For anyone with mobility issues this could be a challenge and 2 the rooms are not air conditioned. Yes this is Monterey so the room could be kept at a comfortable temperature by keeping the sliding glass door open there is a screen. however sea gulls are REALLY loud and on occasion so are guests using the patios of nearby rooms. All that being said should we have an occasion to return to Monterey we had probably stay here again. We used the valet parking and they were prompt each time we called for the car. Friendly desk staff etc. and we felt the price was reasonable.

Seems like it was a nice hotel once. Hard to know if my somewhat negative reaction is to the Monterey vibe in general or the hotel in particular. Room was a little worn down and interiors dated particularly for the cost. We were able to book an adjoining parlor room which made our small room into a generous suite. Staff seemed less than enthusiastic but provided service as needed. Location is great if you are into Fishermans Wharf. Tourist crowd is just generally not very sophisticated. And do not get a room facing into the plaza unles you have earplugs festival outside sounds like it is happening in our second floor room. Public restrooms in lobby made me think I would never host a wedding here unles you had like your guests to have to wait in line and use a shabby bathroom.

Very Over Priced No Value for the Dollar. Hotel is very over priced for the room location and noise level that we experienced. Spending 35 dollars for a single night room was located at street level could not open a window because of noise horrible beds internet is not free parking is discounted to 20 dollars. Save yourself some money stay outside of the walking distance of Monterey Bay Fishermans Wharf and drive and pay for parking. Remember your paying for parking regardless. Noisy. You could hear every noise outside like it was in the room with you. None of the vending machines worked and when i went to complain i was told they would send water up to the room i was charged 16 for two bottles of artisan water. I was never asked if it was ok nor did i give permission for such a thing. Although the rooms are nice clean and comfortable. Most of the staff is helpful and nice. The location was great and close to all major attractions. Not exactly what a four star hotel should be but all in all not a completely horrible experience.
Great Stay in a Great Location ”. Your missing out if you have not experienced Monterey. Great accommodations and great setting.

Nice hotel but very disappointed. The beds are very very comfortable. I think the under construction aspect of the hotel should be highlighted more on the webpage. I have stayed at The Portola before and was expecting the same excellent experience but I was very disappointed. I felt like I was driving down a sidewalk into a construction zone and then having to carry our bags across the plaza to check in only to be told our rooms were back across the plaza above the parking garage well it did not start off our experience in a terribly positive light. When I showered this morning the tiles in the shower were uneven and hurt my feet. I did not know showering could actually be painful. It actually took away the pleasure of a nice hot shower. We were also very confused and concerned about the in and out with the parking garage. There was an attendant one time out of the 4 times we were in and out. We were told to take our room keys when we checked out but there was no place to turn them in and no attendant on duty when we checked out and left this morning. Very confusing and poor security on cars going in and out. Also when trying to checkout using the tv one room said no one was in that room so checkout was unavailable. The maid walked into the room while my daughter was getting dressed because the system had already checked her out without her doing anything. Hopefully the charges will be correct on my credit card. I spent about 80 for one night for 3 rooms I expected a better overall experience for my money. I expect more from The Portola.

Enjoyed Monterey but. We stayed at this establishment with high hopes for a great hotel but we did not get what we expected. When we checked in to the hotel we went to our room directly and fell asleep as we had a long day of driving that day from los angeles scenic route the soft beds allured us towards them. We fell asleep instantly to be woken up five minutes later by a loud car driving by we thought that by being on a room on the fifth floor that this would not be a problem we then looked outside and saw that our fifth floor room was not that high up. That added to the long walk from the elevators made us want to change rooms when we asked we were offered two rooms the first on the same placement on the 6th floor and one on the third floor closer by. With the noise on the fifth floor we feared that the third floor would be noisier and the long walking distance on the 6th we chose to save time and not move. We then went to tell people about the experience and realized there was no free wifi and it cost 995 a day at 2 Mbps ridiculous huh. Especially because the restaurant we went to had free wifi. My dad then came up and told us about 19 a night SELF PARKING not valet which is 22 a night absolutely ridiculous. EDIT they gave us chocolate chip cookies at check in.

Mixed experience glad it was for just one night. Location near wharf and farmers market were great. Jacks bar and restaurant staff were very nice and food great. Had to wait over 40 minutes for our room to be available though we arrived well after check in time. Informed by bellman that there is no central AC in room he was very nice but apparently not trained to explain the standalone air device which we figured out in the middle of the night very noisy wish we had been informed of renovation construction.

do nt bother with this hotel. Good reception staff helpful and efficient. Restaurant was terrible Staff only interested in the people with a conference who were noisy Cold atmosphere mainly because this is a hotel only interested in conferences.

Excellent Location. My husband and I stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary arriving around 1030 pm after two flights. I had arranged with the concierge to have a bottle of wine and a fruit and cheese plate waiting on our room on arrival which we got to enjoy outside on our balcony. The lobby is beautiful with live trees throughout and the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is right by Fishermans Wharf and the bike pedestrian path along the water. Cannery Row is walkable but I preferred biking there. We were able to rent bikes at Adventures by the Sea right there at the Portola. We had an excellent stay but the pool and hot tub had lots of active children jumping in and out and we wanted more of a romantic scene instead of a family one. If you have children however both you and they would absolutely love it. Upon check in children receive a pirate bag with some sort of questions or clues that take them all over the hotel on an adventure. WE loved it and would definitely stay again. the lobby area with the trees and the friendly staff Fishermans Wharf Cannery Row the Monterey Bay Aquarium biking kayaking the carpet in the hallways appears dated and worn.
location structure setting and design. staff at register desk could be more holpful.

Excellent stay at Portol Hotel and Spa. Literally every minute second experience we had was fantastic. We stayed for our anniversary over the weekend and were greeted with smiling faces warm chocolate chip cookies and even a bottle of champagne when we got up to our rom on the house. We had drinks a few nights at the bar in the hotel and the staff was phenomenal. Pool and spa were also a nightly visit. I ca n’t say enough good things about this place. We were so sad to leave and are already planning our next trip. Valet guys were always prompt and polite when we needed to get our car to cruise a bit. This experience made us loyal and frequent visitors. Room was fantastic and the view was spectacular. Thanks to Portola staff for making our stay out of this world.
A beautiful setting with fantastic service.
Beautful nice ambiance.
Very nice place with a good vibe and good customer service.

Perfect location for a short stay in Monterey. We liked that there were restaurants nearby and easy access to the waterfront and Cannery Row. Very friendly staff. Trendy atrium and lovely decordid not really bother us but it was mainly a conference hotel.
Great atmosphere great location. Staff was friendly. Breakfast buffet was awesome. Definitely would stay again.
Exceptional. Great location decent gym and nice vibe.

Very Good. Location easy walk to wharf and local restaurants Great atmosphere during Christmas stay and afternoon drink put on by hotel. Wi Fi went out during stay as did TVParking on site at cost local street parking is limited hours for most daysA little run down compared to pictures.

Wonderful. Loved the lobby which was decorated for Christmas. It was lively with music and a gingerbread house contest to add to the ambiance. Visited a brewery around the corner from the hotel and watched ice skaters behind the hotel as well. The room was roomy. Our floor was in the middle of a remodel. Would love to see it when it is completed.
